intro: Goniothalamus macrophyllus var. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam giant yew, is a member of the family Myristicaceae and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a large evergreen tree characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red berries that contain seeds surrounded by a white, fleshy aril. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
